comment: standardise Nitro groups (+/- form is needed to distinguish between NH2 and NO2)
deprotonate neutral phosphates / phosphonic acidneeded to preserve  chirality
deprotonate -1 phosphates / phosphonic acidneeded to preserve  chirality
deprotonate sulfuric / sulfonic acid, needed to preserve  chirality
deprotonate sulfinic acid (but not sulfonic acid) => sulfur must have exactly three neighbouring atoms
hydroxamic acids (pKa ~ 8.5), N must be 0, otherwise it is probably an N-oxide, carbonly oxygen must by C:2, otherwise chirality is inverted, not sure why
sulfonamid (aromatic or alkene substituent), needed to preserve  chirality
sulfonamid (carbonyl substituent), needed to preserve  chirality
sulfonamid (alkyl syb.), needed to preserve  chirality
deprotonate tetrazole, needed to preserve  chirality
deprotonate tetrazole, needed to preserve  chirality
protontate prim amine if no aromatic substituent
protontate sec amine, if no aromatic substituent, inverts stereo centre
protontate tert amine (not quart.), if no aromatic substituent
4-aminopyridine, because 4-aminopyrimidine is so bacic, this rule is below the exlcusion rules for all the halogenated stuff
neutralize acids / alcohols, but not n-oxids
deprotonate N.2 nitrogens, this rule inverts stereocentres, I have no clue how to keep them
rescue amidine, guanidine, double because of same strange compounds
